Yes, over time new designs and themes have been introduced in Tanjore paintings. While the traditional themes revolve around Hindu deities, mythological scenes, and holy scriptures, modern Tanjore paintings have expanded to include a range of contemporary themes.

Some modern themes that are becoming popular in Tanjore paintings include portraits of popular personalities such as Mahatma Gandhi, Mother Teresa, and Dr. B.R. Ambedkar. Artists are also depicting landscapes, floral motifs, and abstract art in the Tanjore style. In addition, Tanjore paintings are also being used to create eclectic art pieces and home decor items such as lampshades, coasters, and wall hangings.

In terms of designs, modern Tanjore paintings are featuring new motifs and elements such as birds, animals, and geometric patterns. The traditional settings in which the deities were depicted are also being replaced with contemporary settings, such as urban landscapes.

Despite these modernizations, the traditional techniques and materials of Tanjore paintings continue to be incorporated into modern designs, preserving the authenticity and uniqueness of Tanjore paintings.
